gobblin.hive

Class HiveRegProps

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.configuration.State
      • gobblin.hive.HiveRegProps
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WritableShim

    @Alpha
public class HiveRegProps
extends State
    An extension to State for Hive registration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HiveRegProps

        public HiveRegProps(State props)
        Parameters:
        props - A State object that includes both properties required by HiveMetaStoreBasedRegister to do Hive registration, as well as the Hive properties that will be added to the Hive table when creating the table, e.g., orc.compress=SNAPPY

        The Hive table properties should be a comma-separated list associated with HIVE_TABLE_PARTITION_PROPS in the given State.

      • HiveRegProps

        public HiveRegProps(State props,
                    State tableProps,
                    State storageProps,
                    State serdeProps)
        Parameters:
        props - Properties required by HiveMetaStoreBasedRegister to do Hive registration
        tableProps - Hive properties that will be added to the Hive table when creating the table, e.g., orc.compress=SNAPPY

    • Method Detail

      • getDbRootDir

        public Optional<String> getDbRootDir()
        Get Hive database root dir from HIVE_DB_ROOT_DIR.
        Returns:
        Optional.absent() if HIVE_DB_ROOT_DIR is not specified.

      • getUpstreamDataAttrName

        public Optional<String> getUpstreamDataAttrName()
        Get the name of registered HiveTable's upstream data attributes. E.g., When data consumed from Kafka is registered into Hive Table, it is expected to have Hive Metadata indicating the Kafka topic. HIVE_UPSTREAM_DATA_ATTR_NAMES is comma separated string, each item representing a upstream data attr. E.g. hive.upstream.data.attr.names=topic.name,some.else
        Returns:
        Optional.absent() if HIVE_UPSTREAM_DATA_ATTR_NAMES is not specified.

      • getNumThreads

        public int getNumThreads()
        Get number of threads from HIVE_REGISTER_THREADS, with a default value of DEFAULT_HIVE_REGISTER_THREADS.
